top_categories.workout_context: Racing Le Grand du Nord isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Le Grand du Nord’s north shore forest roads, minnesota northwoods gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
At 110 miles, Le Grand du Nord punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Le Grand du Nord’s rolling north shore gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Le Grand du Nord rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Le Grand du Nord when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Le Grand du Nord — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Le Grand du Nord. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Le Grand du Nord — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on rolling north shore gravel.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Le Grand du Nord’s rolling north shore gravel delivers on race day.
Every session at Le Grand du Nord intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Le Grand du Nord’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Le Grand du Nord’s 110 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Le Grand du Nord requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on rolling north shore gravel to build confidence. Expect: north shore forest roads, minnesota northwoods gravel, lake superior scenic routes.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and Durability to prepare you for 110 miles of rolling north shore gravel in Grand Marais, Minnesota.
